intro: Endlicheria sprucei, commonly known as the Andes bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Endlicheria sprucei is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in botanical gardens.
